docs.text: Genomics Learning Workshop This hands-on workshop is designed to introduce students to the basic analysis pipeline for Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) reads, specifically from the Illumina platform for population genetics analysis. We’ll focus on whole genome resequencing (WGS) data, though the same pipeline can be adapted for RAD-seq or amplicon-seq if a reference genome is available. 🧠 Learning Outcomes By the end of this workshop, you will be able to: Work with raw sequencing data ( FASTQ files) Perform quality control and preprocessing Map reads to a reference genome Call and filter genetic variants (SNPs/indels) 💻 Pre-requisites & Setup Please ensure you can access a Unix/Linux shell environment, as all tools will be run from the command line. - Windows : Install MobaXterm - Mac/Linux : You can use the built-in Terminal Review: Understand_Linux_commands 📚 Foundational Resources 🔬 How Illumina Sequencing Works 🐧 Linux Shell Basics Linux_basics.sh Solutions ⚙️ Advanced Linux Commands Linux_advanced.sh Solutions 🧬 Dataset Download We’ll use real WGS data (subset) for demo purposes. ➡️ Download Dataset from Zenodo To download via terminal: ```bash mkdir workshop_data cd workshop_data wget
